1. 提issue的时候注意一下规范，参照rocketmq template；
2. 提问请在官方邮件列表中提；
3. 根据你的问题描述，不好判断哪里有问题，我在自己电脑上也无法重现你的问题。请求nameserver的过程中，如果有网络问题，也可能会报no route info。报No route info of this topic错误时，先看rocketmq_client.log，看里面是否有更多的报错信息。如果日志中也不能排查到问题，建议可以在本地跑一下example包下的org.apache.rocketmq.example.quickstart.Producer，然后调试一下，client端代码不多，可以很快走到抛错的地方，确认问题。

As mentioned above,the code of client is not complex，you can debug the client module and will find detail reason.@toto1297488504
We will confirm this issue in these days. @zymming

I checked the current implementation: 
1. If the master is alive, consume offset will always commit to master broker. ConsumerProgress command queries offset from the master.
2. If the master is down, consume offset will commit to the slave broker with minimum id. In this situation, consumerProgress command will pick a random slave to query offset. We should do some optimize in this case. 

So, if you are the first case, check whether offset commit failed or other problems. If you are in the second case, it's the problem of the current implementation.

1. The format of issue should reference to the RocketMQ template.
2. Issue is only for bug report or feature request. You can ask your question via mailing list.
3. I think the "one queue, one thread" means a queue can't be consume concurrently. There's nothing to do with the thread number. The consumeExecutor is used to execute the consume request of different consume queue.

1. The issue tracker is **ONLY** used for bug report(feature request need to follow [RIP process](https://github.com/apache/rocketmq/wiki/RocketMQ-Improvement-Proposal)). 
2. In the current implementation, we suggest consumer client deal with idempotent in business code
to solve repeat consumption problem.
@DengTin OpenMessaging Golang SDK has been in the development plan, and if you are interested in this, welcome to participate in the development process.

> if I add a new type == 0x4 << 3 ( 16 ) ,
> the new type dont work right ( return flag & TRANSACTION_ROLLBACK_TYPE )
> what the real meaning of ( return flag & TRANSACTION_ROLLBACK_TYPE )

If you want a new bit to express a new mean, just check the specific bit.  Method getTransactionValue only concern the third and fourth bits, there is nothing to do with your new bit.

@ymwneu A queue can't be consume concurrently ，but a queue can be many thread consumer , I don't know if I understand it right .

> I checked the current implementation:
> 
> 1. If the master is alive, consume offset will always commit to master broker. ConsumerProgress command queries offset from the master.
> 2. If the master is down, consume offset will commit to the slave broker with minimum id. In this situation, consumerProgress command will pick a random slave to query offset. We should do some optimize in this case.
> 
> So, if you are the first case, check whether offset commit failed or other problems. If you are in the second case, it's the problem of the current implementation.

Another condition for case 1 is I have enabled slave. When read for messages for days ago, master will give suggestion broker id for client to pull from. Client PullAPIWrapper will check suggestion brokerId for each pull. And  PullMessageProcessor will commit offset.
It seems different with your description? Would you please help to check  again?

Notice the code:
 `sc.socket().connect(remote, timeoutMillis);`
Config blocking can make sure connect established after the connect method return.

I think just separate the api of client and management can't solve the risk of broker thoroughly. Set ACL can help control the authority of modify broker config. I found the latest version RocketMQ is already support ACL.
I think separate the api of client ,simplify the api of client that business apply . The ACL should modify the files , not conveniently .

Hi @hwind001 ,RocketMQ 4.4.0 version has already supported the acl feature,You can try it in you developping enviroment.If you meet any problem in trying acl feature,you can find me to resolve it.Thank you!

A good ISSUE.
Two problems:
1. -d can accept both "yyyy-MM-dd#HH:mm:ss:SSS" or long style timestamp. Look PrintMessageByQueueCommand#timestampFormat for more detail.
2. Your PR have a bug, i have already given my comment.
The max offset problem, i suggest you optimize method "PrintMessageByQueueCommand#calculateByTag" and "PrintMessageByQueueCommand#printMessage" to filter the messages which exceed the max offset.
